intro: Bouvardia nivea, commonly known as the white bouvardia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub with slender, woody stems and glossy, oval-shaped leaves. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardens. Bouvardia nivea is often used in floral arrangements due to its elegant appearance and long-lasting blooms.
